landingPage.subHeader: Maximize the power of your assets and start earning yield with Backd's liquidity pools.

reactiveLiquidity.description: Create Actions to automate your liquidity to where it is needed most.

earnYield.description: Earn interest on liquidity via yield-farming strategies such as Curve and Convex.

feeShare.description: Receive part of the fees that are charged on actions.

deposit.description: Deposit funds into Backd liquidity pools and receive pool LP tokens.

earn.description: Earn compounded yield from strategy profits and protocol fees as LP tokens appreciate over the underlying tokens.

stake.description: Stake your pool LP tokens to receive Backd rewards.

claim.description: Unstake your LP tokens or claim your Backd rewards at any time.

deposit.description: Deposit funds into Backd liquidity pools and receive pool LP tokens.

register.description: Register Compound or Aave loans on-chain to receive collateral top-ups, and stake your pool LP tokens to earn Backd rewards.

protect.description: Earn compounded yield and protocol fees as the LP token appreciates, while keepers monitor your loan and transfer your capital to avoid liquidation.

claim.description: Unregister or update a position, withdraw LP tokens or claim Backd rewards at any time.

uniswap.description: Backd Keepers detect when the price has moved outside of your defined range and move the liquidity into Backdâ€™s yield pools. Once the price is back within range, Keepers move your liquidity back into Uniswap.

limitOrders.description: Once a limit order can be filled, a Keeper can withdraw the required funds from yield pools and execute the trade on the AMM.

curveImbalance.description: Keepers can detect when LP pools become imbalanaced and remove liquidity for you on your behalf - saving you from substantial losses.

nfts.description: Create a limit order for an NFT with a specific set of rarity traits. Once the price drops within your desired amount, a purchase Action is executed and liquidity is removed from Backdâ€™s yield pools.

propose.description: Actions can be added through the Backd DAO. Join the Backd community and propose a new action!

getStarted.description: Deposit liquidity and start earning yield.

notFound.subHeader: Try one of the handy links below - or <0>get in touch</0> if you believe there is an issue.

introduction.paragraph1: <0>Backd</0> is a trustless and interest generating protocol that automates asset efficiency through yield aggregation and customizable liquidity delegation. The Backd protocolâ€™s reactive liquidity pools empower DeFi users through the realization of greater asset utility, efficient aggregation of yield, and mitigation of opportunity cost.

capitalEfficiency.paragraph1: In the traditional finance (TradFi) world capital efficiency is the ratio of how much a company is spending on growing revenue and how much they are getting in return. Something that requires low capital but generates high returns is considered to be highly capital efficient.
capitalEfficiency.paragraph2: In DeFi capital efficiency has become somewhat of an ironic term. The term is often overused and while DeFi claims to be capital efficient, it often isnâ€™t.

notEfficient.paragraph1: DeFi protocols today generally focus on fulfilling one specific function. This may include borrowing and lending, market orders, yield aggregation, etc. While many protocols fulfill specific needs in a capital efficient way, the broader DeFi ecosystem is left inefficient.
notEfficient.paragraph2: This is because DeFi today is bounded by static or single-utility liquidity pools. Meaning, liquidity must be dedicated to only serving one function at a time. Every time a user deposits assets into a protocol they realize the opportunity cost of not having their assets allocated elsewhere. This is one of the reasons why yield aggregating protocols do not capture more total value locked (TVL). Every dollar increase in provided liquidity results in an increased realized opportunity cost.
notEfficient.paragraph3: Individuals often make the argument that if your assets are not earning yield you are losing money. While this statement might be true if the alternative is holding cash in a TradFi savings account, it is a fallacy when applied to DeFi. Deploying your assets to a yield farming protocol might actually result in a loss when compared to market returns. The correct argument is that if your assets are not earning yield at the right time you are losing money.

earnYield.header: Earning yield at the right time
earnYield.paragraph1: Generally the correct time to deploy your assets to earn yield is during periods of high volatility (trading fees) or high demand for leverage (lending rates). However, there is no generic or universal formula for when to provide liquidity in a yield farming protocol. This is because every DeFi user has their own unique strategy which comes with specific needs.
earnYield.paragraph2: To this date, DeFi users have had to manually shift their liquidity between earning yield and other positions in order to stay efficient. This has placed somewhat of an efficiency ceiling on DeFi users. The rapidly evolving and highly volatile nature of crypto makes maintaining capital efficiency through manually delegating liquidity virtually impossible.

reactiveLiquidity.paragraph1: Backd eliminates this aforementioned capital inefficiency through the deployment of novel multi-utility liquidity pools. Until now, yield farming protocols have focused on solving opportunity cost by trying to increase yield. However yield is not a solution to opportunity cost, it is compensation.
reactiveLiquidity.paragraph2: Backd effectively mitigates opportunity cost and thus increases capital efficiency by changing the nature or utility of provided liquidity itself. Unlike normal yield-farming protocols, where provided liquidity will remain static until the user withdraws it, liquidity deposited into Backd can autonomously react to market conditions or user defined variables. Specifically, users can add customizable actions to their provided liquidity. Adding an action allows users to earn yield until their assets are more efficient elsewhere. At which point, the Backd protocol will automatically delegate your liquidity to where it is needed.
reactiveLiquidity.paragraph3: Backd generates yield from both yield-farming strategies and actions. Every time an action occurs on Backd, a small action fee is charged and paid out to Backd liquidity providers. It is important to note that registering an action to your Backd liquidity is optional. Actions are solely an additional utility layer, empowering liquidity providers to do more with their deposits. Because Backd is able to capture yield beyond strategy profits, it can be an optimal option for users only looking to farm yield and not to make their liquidity reactive.

action.paragraph1: The first action that Backd will support, which will be available at launch, is collateral top ups. Support for more actions will be added in the future. The core protocol architecture of Backd is designed in a way that makes adding new actions, strategies, or supported protocols (for actions) easy. This allows Backd to perpetually increase yield and utility for LPs as DeFi evolves.

what.paragraph1: A top-up is the act of depositing additional collateral in order to increase the health factor of your loan or mitigate liquidation risk. Backd liquidity providers can use their Backd LP tokens to register top-up positions. This creates back up collateral or what you could call interest earning liquidation protection. When a user registers a top-up position they must specify how much of their Backd liquidity should be shifted and at what health factor a top-up should occur. After registering a top-up position the Backd userâ€™s liquidity will continue to be allocated to yield-farming strategies until it is needed.
what.paragraph2: Backdâ€™s Top-up positions increase collateral efficiency by enabling any borrower on supported protocols (Backd will support Aave & Compound loans at launch) to earn yield with their collateral. Furthermore this also enables borrowers to increase leverage by depositing less collateral and hedge liquidation risk by automatically posting extra collateral when needed.
what.paragraph3: Backd creates an infrastructure that enables the combination of on-chain actions, off-chain keepers that react to market events, and yield-farming. This unique combination lends itself to a multitude of actions and integration with many protocols. Backd not only makes liquidity more efficient, but also makes other protocols safer and smarter.

fees.paragraph1: The protocol architecture that facilitates Backdâ€™s reactive liquidity creates the framework for a fee generating powerhouse. The Backd protocols platform fees can be broken up into two main categories (actions and strategies).

action.paragraph1: Every time an action is executed, a fee is collected in the form of LP tokens. Part of that fee is sent directly to liquidity providers which in turn compounds yield, while a portion is paid to the keeper that executes an action. Action fees create yield diversified from traditional strategies. For example, Backd collateral top up fees will generate higher returns during periods of market volatility (because more loans will need to be topped up).

strategies.paragraph1: A performance fee is charged on profits harvested by strategies. A share of this performance fee is paid to the strategist of the yield-farming strategy employed, while a small part of the fee is kept in a poolâ€™s reserve fund.

token.paragraph1: The Backd governance token distribution is designed to incentive participation among three core protocol stakeholders (liquidity providers, AMM liquidity providers, and Keepers). The majority of the token supply will be distributed to these stakeholders. More information regarding Backd tokenecomics can be found in the <0>docs</0>.
token.paragraph2: The Backd governance token is the native ERC-20 token of the Backd protocol. Token holders can lock their tokens to participate in protocol governance. Additionally, locked Backd governance tokens receive a share of the protocol fees or revenue. This share of protocol fees or revenue will be determined by the locking period that the Backd governance token holder selects.
token.paragraph3: Protocol governance will be executed on-chain and can include (but is not limited to):

community.paragraph1: The Backd protocol will ultimately (through the launch of the Backd DAO) be controlled by the community. Backdâ€™s reactive liquidity creates unique opportunities for community contributions that do not involve on-chain governance.
community.paragraph2: Contributions can include (but are not limited to):
community.paragraph3: If you are interested in becoming a Backd contributor, chat with us in our contributions <0>discord channel</0>! Individuals who contribute to Backd can be granted special server roles and may be subject to future rewards ðŸ‘€

pools.overview: Backdâ€™s single-asset pools aggregate yield across strategies. After depositing an asset, register an action to automate your liquidity to where it is needed most.

tvl.tooltip: The market capitalization of total assets held in Backd liquidity pools (total value locked)

apy.tooltip: The average annual percent yield over a 30 day period

revenue.tooltip: The total value of fees generated by the Backd protocol

deposits.tooltip: The current value of your assets held in Backd liquidity pools

locked.tooltip: The current value of your assets that are allocated to Actions. Assets allocated to Actions still earn yield

rewards.tooltip: The current value of earned rewards that have yet to be claimed

pool.overview: Deposit {{asset}} to begin earning yield via the {{strategy}} strategy. Once you have deposited, you can make your liquidity reactive by creating an action.

tvl.tooltip: The market capitalization of assets held in the pool (total value locked)

apy.tooltip: The current annual percent yield earned by pool LPs

lp.tooltip: The current exchange rate of {{lpToken}} to {{underlying}}. {{underlying}}={{lpToken}}*{{exchangeRate}}

strategy.tooltip: The current protocol funds are allocated to for yield farming strategies

deposits.tooltip: The current value of your assets held in the pool

locked.tooltip: The current value of your assets that are allocated to Actions. Assets allocated to Actions still earn yield

rewards.tooltip: The current value of earned rewards that have yet to be claimed

Enter an amount of {{asset}} to withdraw

actions.overview: Use this screen to monitor your Actions. Actions are a set of predefined market triggers, that when occur, something is done on your behalf.

topup.header: We have found a protectable loan!
topup.subHeader: The wallet you have connected has a loan that you can create a top-up position for.

topup.label: Top-up Position
topup.description: Use your Backd deposits as back-up collateral to protect your overcollateralised loans on Aave or Compound from getting liquidated.

loan.subHeader: Backd has detected the following loans on supported platforms associated with your current connected wallet:
loan.search: Or, enter wallet address with a loan:
loan.enterAddress: Enter the wallet address that the loan is associated with:
loan.notFound: No loans associated with this address.
loan.alreadyExists: A top-up action already exists for this loan

pool.header: Which pool do you want the top-up to come from?
pool.noDepositsHeader: To register an action you must deposit assets into a Backd pool
pool.subHeader: Liquidity deposited into a Backd pool can be earmarked for top-up protection. You will earn yield and BKD rewards while your liquidity is in a Backd pool.

deposit.header: Enter an amount of {{asset}} to deposit
deposit.subHeader: This {{asset}} can be transported over to protect your position in one or multiple lots.

conditions.subHeader: Define the specific market triggers that determine when a top-up position will activate.

confirmation.summaryEnd: drops below {{threshold}}, it will be topped up with {{single}} {{asset}} ({{singleUsd}}). This will be repeated each time the collateralization ratio drops below {{threshold}}, until a total of {{max}} {{asset}} ({{maxUsd}}) is topped up.

delete.body: Deleting this top-up position will remove automated collateral top-ups of {{asset}} on {{protocol}}. {{max}} {{asset}} will be unstaked and can be withdrawn after removing the position.

protocol.label: Protocol
protocol.tooltip: The lending protocol on which the user is borrowing funds (currently compatible with Aave and Compound)

address.label: Address
address.tooltip: The address of the owner of the position to top-up (e.g. if Alice is the borrower on Aave that should be topped up then this would be Aliceâ€™s address)
address.unique: Max of one position per protocol and address

threshold.label: Threshold
threshold.question: What health factor do you want the top-up Action to trigger at?
threshold.tooltip: The health factor threshold a collateral top-up should occur at

single.label: Single Top-up
single.question: How much would you like to transfer per single top-up?
single.tooltip: Amount of a single top-up increment (e.g. top-up increments of 2,500 DAI)
single.lessThanMax: Must be less than max top-up

max.label: Max Top-up
max.question: What would you like the total top-up amount to be?
max.tooltip: Maximum top-up amount (value of your liquidity allocated for top-ups)

gas.label: Max Gas Price
gas.question: What is the maximum gas price to pay per top-up?
gas.tooltip: The maximum gas price used when paying for each top-up. Value is in Gwei units. If value is too low, then your top-up may not execute in time which could result in liquidation. A value of at least 200 Gwei is recommended.
gas.exceedsMax: Not enough to cover gas cost of top-up
